Configuring the mouse speed and eye control

Mouse speed

Some advanced users may like the mouse cursor to move very fast to do some tasks in the minimum possible time. Other users may have some involuntary eye movements and may require to move the mouse slowly and ignore the unwanted movements.

The API can be configured to smooth the gaze data according to the users needs. There are 15 smooth degrees, from 0 to 14, where 0 means the mouse is very fast, and 14 means the mouse is very slow but very stable. It is recommended to start setting it to 2, and increase the smoothness if the users need it. Lower smoothness values are available for very advanced users, who may prefer speed over stability.

Setting the smoothness is as easy as calling

IrisbondDuo.setSmoothValue(2);

Eye control

Some users may have a problem in one eye that make the eye tracking a hard experience. For those cases, the API can work with only one eye and ignore the other one. The code for the eye configuration can be found in IrisbondAPI::CONTROLLING_EYE

For example, to ignore the right eye and work with the left eye only, the code is as simple as:

IrisbondDuo.setUserEyeControlMode(IrisbondDuo.CONTROLLING_EYE.CONTROL_LEFT );
